title: Merged testnet doesn't sync back after being offline for a few days
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description My issue is similar to this, but the error messages are not quite the same: https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/11279 I have a Goeli/Prater testnet running for some time. I don't usually keep it up 100% of the time, I usually just stop geth and prysm just so that 1) it doesn't use much of my Internet 2) I can test how it syncs back after being down. I've done this up and down cycles for a while, the setup merged and moved to PoS when that happened, I kept it up for a couple of days, then stopped it. I started everything again after a week or so, but now it doesn't seem to be syncing back again like it used to. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Yes, although I don't think it's version related, more like a pre/post merge thing. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction * Have a Geth/Prysm beacon pair running fine, merged using PoS * Stop the services and let a few days go by * Start everything back up, now it's not syncing ## üî• Error This is what's been logging for a few hours now: 

beacon-testnet_1     | time="2022-08-22 15:29:54" level=info msg="Processing block batch of size 41 starting from  0xde547ff2... 3639936/3722849 - estimated time remaining 11h14m5s" blocksPerSecond=2.0 peers=5 prefix=initial-sync
beacon-testnet_1     | time="2022-08-22 15:29:57" level=warning msg="Batch is not processed" error="could not process block in batch: could not retrieve block roots: invalid end slot and start slot provided" prefix=initial-sync
beacon-testnet_1     | time="2022-08-22 15:29:57" level=info msg="Processing block batch of size 41 starting from  0x760fad54... 3639999/3722849 - estimated time remaining 5h36m47s" blocksPerSecond=4.1 peers=5 prefix=initial-sync
beacon-testnet_1     | time="2022-08-22 15:29:58" level=warning msg="Batch is not processed" error="could not process block in batch: could not fill in missing blocks to forkchoice: not descendant of finalized checkpoint" prefix=initial-sync
beacon-testnet_1     | time="2022-08-22 15:29:58" level=info msg="Processing block batch of size 41 starting from  0x9a57fc36... 3640063/3722849 - estimated time remaining 3h44m21s" blocksPerSecond=6.2 peers=5 prefix=initial-sync

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
2.1.4
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?** Let me know I can provide more info to diagnose, this worries me a bit for the mainnet setup. Is just starting the services up again enough to have both EL/CL sync up like it used to happen, should that be done in an order? both together? I already tried restarting everything, multiple times, in different order to no avail. How would something like this get fixed in case it was DB corruption now that EL/CL work together? Can I start prysm from scratch? should I do prysm and geth both from the beginning? Here's what geth is logging in case it helps: ``` geth-testnet_1 | WARN [08-22|15:34:46.283] Ignoring already known beacon payload number=7,383,122 hash=0dd2e5..0ad224 age=1w4d12h geth-testnet_1 | Hey @pablote , your issue seems different from the other issue. Do you have all your logs during this period ? Ex: before offline period, during offline period, after back online period
No sorry, I don't keep logs of before the offline period, it was just running fine then. And after starting things back again it's logging what I posted continously.

No worries, it would be helpful if you had the logs of when it first started going wrong. As usually it would give an indication of what is wrong with the node. But in any case, we can continue investigating this on our end.

Maybe I didn't explain correctly the scenario. There's no point in time, and in the logs, in which Prysm beacon goes from working well to stop syncing with these messages. Prysm was working well, it was stopped for a week, and then started again. It's when starting it again that it can't seem to sync back. I'm attaching logs from service startup:
